Server¶

The server is available as brain_storm.server and expose the following API:

>>> from brain_storm.server import run_server
>>> def print_message(message):
...     print(message)
>>> run_server(host='127.0.0.1', port=8000, publish=print_message)
… # listen on host:port and pass received messages to publish

And the following CLI:

$ python -m cortex.server run-server

-h/–host ‘127.0.0.1’ -p/–port 8000 ‘rabbitmq://127.0.0.1:5672/’

Note that the API lets callers pass any publishing function, while the CLI only lets them pass a URL to a message queue, to which the server then connects and publishes the data.

The server’s job is: to accept connection, receive the uploaded samples and publish them to its message queue.
